p: Clinical trials of treatments for seasonal influenza have been performed in Japan and US, and favipiravir was approved as a treatment for novel or re-emerging influenza viruses in Japan in 2014. Favipiravir is considered for administration to patients only when the government judges that this drug will be used as a countermeasure against novel or re-emerging influenza viruses. The Japanese government and Taiwanese Centers for Disease Control (CDCs) decided to stockpile favipiravir for the people as a countermeasure for severe influenza. Favipiravir has been submitted for additional indications for severe fever with thrombocytopenia syndrome (SFTS) based on clinical trials ( Yasukawa, 2016) in addition to influenza in Japan.
